III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In July of 2022, Youth A was dragged and thrown around by Staff
2.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
02/26/2024.
I emailed complainant and no additional information was
provided.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing violations and
MISACWIS history for Youth A. Youth A was placed at the agency
on 12/08/2021 and discharged on 07/22/2022 to an independent
living program in Kalamazoo. Youth A’s MISACWIS case was
closed on 01/24/2023 and last contact with Youth A was made
01/24/2023. A telephone number was found in the system for
Youth A.
Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator (CA) on 01/29/2024 via
telephone. CA reported Youth A was placed at the agency from
12/8/2021 to 07/22/2022. Youth A was released to a Specialized
Independent Living program in Kalamazoo. He denied any
incident involving Youth A being dragged or hurt by Staff 2. He
said there is one incident dated 07/14/2022 involving Youth A
being restrained for aggressive behavior, but there is no
documentation that Youth A was dragged or hurt during that
incident. CA said Staff 2 resigned from the agency in October of
2022 and is no longer employed at the agency.
2

I attempted to contact Youth A via telephone (telephone number
listed in MISACWIS) on 1/29/2024, the telephone number found
was incorrect.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 02/26/2024 via telephone. Staff 1 is the
residential coordinator and has been working at the agency for 20
years. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was the afternoon supervisor. Staff
1 recalled Youth A being at the agency in 2022 and said Youth A
never reported Staff 2 dragged or hurt him. Youth A was very
outspoken and if staff did something, Youth A would have spoken
about it. She said Staff 2 was very calm and liked by all the
youths. She does not recall any youths ever complaining about
Staff 2. She said Staff 2 resigned in 2022 because he was working
another job and there was more room for advancement in the
other job.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 03/01/2024 via telephone. Staff 2 reported
he was employed at the agency for 7 years and resigned in
October of 2022. He worked as a 2nd shift supervisor prior to
leaving the agency. Staff 2 denied dragging or ever hurting Youth
A. He recalled having a good rapport with Youth A and does not
recall any incident where he used an inappropriate method to
physically manage a youth. He could not recall the incident on
07/14/2022 when Youth A was restrained. Staff 2 said he could
not recall what happened or why Youth A was restrained.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 03/01/2024 via telephone. Staff 3 is a
residential counselor and has been working at the agency for
almost four years. Staff 3 recalls the incident on 07/14/2022, and
said Youth A was being aggressive and assaultive, so Youth A
was restrained by her and Staff 2. She denied Youth A was
dragged or hurt during the restraint. Staff 3 said Staff 2 is by the
book and always attempted verbal de-escalation before physically
restraining a youth.
I interviewed Youth A’s Probation Officer on 03/04/2024 via
telephone. Several attempts had been made prior to contact
Probation Officer, but he had been off and returned to work on
03/04/2024. Probation Officer reported he was Youth A’s
probation officer for approximately one year and it was during the
time Youth A was placed at the agency. He said Youth A never
reported ever being dragged or hurt and always spoke very highly
of the staff while placed at the agency. Probation Officer had
attempted to reach out to Youth A after Youth A was discharged
but was unsuccessful.
3

I received an email from Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist on
03/07/2024, stating Youth A was discharged from the Independent
Living Program in November of 2022 and she does not have
contact information for Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Behavior Management Policy and Procedures states,
Physical behavior management intervention is used only
when it is assessed a youth is at risk of imminent harm to
themselves or others. The CPI Crisis Development Model
documents that staff learning appropriate and effective
approaches to crisis behaviors presented by youth. Staff's
responses are outlined and range from de-escalation to
physical restraint, physical management is the last option
after staff have exhausted all other efforts to de-escalate
the youth and they remain a danger to themselves or
others.
• Youth A’s release plan dated 07/05/2022 through
07/22/2022. Youth A was discharged to an independent
living home on 07/22/2022.
• Incident report dated 07/14/2022 at approximately 6:07pm.
Written by Staff 2. Youth A returned from dining hall in a
state of anxiety, attempting to fight anyone who would take
the challenge. Staff 3 attempted to verbally calm Youth A
down. Staff 2 and Staff 3 placed Youth A in a team control
restraint. No injuries documented.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with the restraint of Youth A as
evidence provided through written documentation and interviews
with staff indicates staff conducted an appropriate restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
